definition: to peel/to skin/to tear/to pull down/to cling to (sth on which one is climbing)/to dig
to rake up/to steal/to braise/to crawl

sentences.english: Oh, one more thing, I've ordered another dish, stuffed pork chop. Can it be served sooner?
sentences.chinese: 对了，我还点了一个酿猪扒，能否快些上来？

sentences.english: All Japanese pork chop specialist will have you ground your own sesame to make the sauce.
sentences.chinese: 所有日色猪扒店都会要你自己磨芝麻做酱料。

sentences.english: And a pork chop can give you 100% of your recommended daily allowance of vegetable products.
sentences.chinese: 一块猪扒就可以给你提供你一整天所需要的蔬菜养分。

sentences.english: Our lunch was Zhuba bread, the characteristics of Macao, which tasted very good.
sentences.chinese: 午餐是澳门特色的猪扒包，很好吃。

sentences.english: Wash, wipe and pound pork chops. Marinate for half an hour.
sentences.chinese: 猪扒洗净，抹干水拍松，加腌料腌半小时。

sentences.english: Secret recipe created by the founders of Ginza Bairin in 1927.
sentences.chinese: 猪扒秘方酱汁是由创始人在1927年发明的。

sentences.english: Myeong-dong's most famous food is fried pork chop and sliced noodles.
sentences.chinese: 明洞最有名的食品是炸猪扒和刀削面。

sentences.english: Try this simplified version of Orange Pork Chop Stir-fry.
sentences.chinese: 试一下这个糖醋猪扒的简化版本吧。

sentences.english: Choose pork chop with fatty meat for a better result.
sentences.chinese: 拣带肥肉的猪扒有较佳效果。
